are the services(t3channel external service) also recreated? can the t3channel node port be changed to something else after restart?

are you forcing pod restart by changing the port here?
yes.
move the code up to maintain the order
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -731,6 +737,163 @@ public void testCreateNewCluster() {
 
   }
 
+  /**
+   * Test changes the WebLogic credentials and verifies the servers can startup and function with changed credentials.
+   * a. Creates new WebLogic credentials using WLST.
+   * b. Creates new Kubernetes secret for WebLogic credentials.
+   * c. Patch the Domain Resource with new credentials, restartVerion and introspectVersion.
+   * d. Verifies the servers in the domain restarted and accessing the admin server console with new password works.
+   * e. Verifies the the admin server console access with old credentials fail.
+   */
+  @Order(3)

nodes.bodyText: Fixed
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -731,6 +737,163 @@ public void testCreateNewCluster() {
 
   }
 
+  /**
+   * Test changes the WebLogic credentials and verifies the servers can startup and function with changed credentials.
+   * a. Creates new WebLogic credentials using WLST.
+   * b. Creates new Kubernetes secret for WebLogic credentials.
+   * c. Patch the Domain Resource with new credentials, restartVerion and introspectVersion.

nodes.bodyText: do we need all of these debug flags?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -856,10 +856,12 @@ private void createDomain() {
             .serverPod(new ServerPod() //serverpod
                 .addEnvItem(new V1EnvVar()
                     .name("JAVA_OPTIONS")
-                    .value("-Dweblogic.debug.DebugSituationalConfig=true"))
-                .addEnvItem(new V1EnvVar()
-                    .name("JAVA_OPTIONS")
-                    .value("-Dweblogic.debug.DebugSituationalConfigDumpXml=true"))

+                        + "-Dweblogic.debug.DebugMessaging=true "
+                        + "-Dweblogic.debug.DebugConnection=true "
+                        + "-Dweblogic.ResolveDNSName=true"))

nodes.bodyText: At least for now we need these flags. These are tests with intermittent failures. In case test fails we will have the logs ready to debug.

print ClusterViewServlet instead of ITTESTS in the entire class

log message 'Getting the list of servers using the listServers' needs to be modified. Also add more details in log and/or comment what is being checked when the call is made to the servlet here.
updated the comment.
call verifyMemberHealth method instead of iterating 5 times?

The call is made to the Servlet just to see if the app is accessible after restart.
switched to dynamic wait instead of fixed iteration.

how about calling verifyMemberHealth before making any config changes are made to make sure the cluster health is good, servers can communicate with each other? This comment applies to initAll method at the end, but I can't add it there, so posting here.
The domain is not created in initAll. Its is created in the first test method, added this check right before config changes are made.
